textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure at least one file named /etc/default/aide exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*SILENTREPORTS\h*=\h*no\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/audit/plugins.d/au-remote.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*active\h*=\h*yes\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/audisp/audisp-remote.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*remote_server\h*=\h*\H+
Ensure at least one file named /boot/grub/grub.cfg exists and matches pattern ^\h*set\h+superusers\h*=\h*\"?\H+\b
Ensure at least one file named /boot/grub/grub.cfg exists and matches pattern ^\h*password_pbkdf2\h+\H+\h+\H+\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/limits.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*\*\h+hard\h+maxlogins\h+(10|[1-9])\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/rsyslog.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*(auth(\.\*)?,authpriv\.\*|authpriv\.\*,auth(\.\*)?)\h+\/var\/log\/secure\/?\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/rsyslog.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*daemon\.\*h+\/var\/log\/messages\/?\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/default/useradd exists and matches pattern ^\s*INACTIVE\s*=\s*35\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/common-auth exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?authfail\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/common-auth exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*auth\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_faillock\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?authsucc\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/faillock.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*audit\h*\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/faillock.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*silent\h*\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/faillock.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*deny\h*=\h*[1-3]\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/faillock.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*fail_interval\h*=\h*(0|9[0-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9]{3,})\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/faillock.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*unlock_time\h*=\h*0\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*dictcheck\h*=\h*[^0]
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*enforcing\h*=\h*1\h*(\h*#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/common-password exists and matches pattern ^\h*password\h+requisite\h+pam_pwquality\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?retry=[1-3]\h*(\h+.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/common-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+required\h+pam_faildelay\.so\h+([^#\n\r]+\h+)?delay=([4-9]|[1-9][0-9])[0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9]+\b
Ensure no file named /etc/sudoers exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h*)?\bNOPASSWD\b(.*)?$
Ensure no file named /etc/sudoers exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?\!authenticate\b(\.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/login exists and matches pattern ^\h*session\h+([^#\n\r]+)\h+pam_lastlog\.so\b
Ensure no file named /etc/pam.d/common-password exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?nullok\b
Ensure no file named /etc/pam.d/common-auth exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?nullok\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*UMASK\h+[0-7]77\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/common-auth exists and matches pattern ^\h*auth\h+[^#\n\r]+\h+pam_pkcs11\.so\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/ssh/sshd_config exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*PubkeyAuthentication\h+yes\h*(\h*#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/pam.d/common-password exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*password\h+[^#\n\r]+\h+pam_unix\.so(\h+[^#\n\r]+)?\h+sha512\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*ucredit\h*=\h*-[1-9]\h*(\h*#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*lcredit\h*=\h*-[1-9]\h*(\h*#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*dcredit\h*=\h*-[1-9]\h*(\h*#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*difok\h*=\h*([8-9]|[1-9][0-9]+)\h*(\h*#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*PASS_MIN_DAYS\h+[1-9][0-9]*\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern ^\s*(?i)PASS_MAX_DAYS\s+(60|[1-5][0-9]|[1-9])(\h*#.*)?\h*$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*minlen\h*=\h*(1[5-9]|[2-9][0-9]|[1-9][0-9][0-9]+)\h*(\h*#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/security/pwquality.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*ocredit\h*=\h*-[1-9]\h*(\h*#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/sssd/sssd.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*offline_credentials_expiration\h*=\h*1\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/sssd/sssd.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*(^\[sssd\].*)?^services\h*=\h*.*\bpam\b.*
Ensure at least one file named /etc/sssd/sssd.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*(^\[pam\].*)?^pam_cert_auth\h*=\h*.*\bTrue\b.*
Ensure at least one file named /etc/sssd/sssd.conf exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\b)?certificate_verification\h*=\h*ca_cert\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/login.defs exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*encrypt_method\h+sha512\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /proc/sys/crypto/fips_enabled exists and matches pattern ^\h*1\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/ssl/certs exists and matches pattern (?i)^([^#\n\r]+)?\bDOD(_|\b)
Ensure at least one file named /etc/chrony/chrony.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*server\h+\H+\.mil\h+iburst\h+maxpoll\h+16\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/chrony/chrony.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*makestep\h1\h-1\h*(#.*)?$

file_test.comment: Ensure at least one file named /usr/bin/journalctl exists and does not have permissions ----wxrwx
Ensure at least one file named /var/log/ exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure at least one file named /var/log/syslog exists and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx SUID SGID sticky

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure no file named /etec/sysctl.conf exists and matches pattern ^\s*kernel\.randomize_va_space\s*=\s*([0-1]|[3-9]|[0-9][0-9]+)\b
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades exists and matches pattern ^\h*Unattended-Upgrade::Remove-Unused-Dependencies\h+["']true["'];\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades exists and matches pattern ^\h*Unattended-Upgrade::Remove-Unused-Kernel-Packages\h+["']true["'];\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file named /etc/audit/auditd.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*action_mail_acct\h*=\h*\H+

systemdunitproperty_test.comment: Ensure systemd 'ctrl-alt-del.target' unit 'UnitFileState' property not equal 'active'
Ensure systemd 'kdump.service' unit 'UnitFileState' property not equal 'active'

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+\.conf$ in /etc/security/limits.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\h*\*\h+hard\h+maxlogins\h+(10|[1-9])\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+/.conf in /etc/rsyslog.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\h*(auth(\.\*)?,authpriv\.\*|authpriv\.\*,auth(\.\*)?)\h+\/var\/log\/secure\/?\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+\.conf in /etc/rsyslog.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\h*daemon\.notice\h+\/var\/log\/messages\/?\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure no file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+)?::AllowUnauthenticated\h+"?true"?;\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure no file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/sudoers.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h*)?\bNOPASSWD\b(.*)?$
Ensure no file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/sudoers.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?\!authenticate\b(\.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+\.conf$ in /etc/sssd/conf.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*offline_credentials_expiration\h*=\h*1\h*(#.*)?$
Ensurefile(s) named ^.+\.conf$ in /etc/sysctl.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\s*kernel\.randomize_va_space\s*=\s*([0-1]|[3-9]|[0-9][0-9]+)\b

file_test.comment: Ensure any file(s) named ^.*\.(conf|rules|prev)$ in /etc/audit/ exists and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx
Ensure any file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/audit/rules.d/ exists and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx
Ensure any file(s) named ^.*\.(conf|rules|prev)$ in /etc/audit/ exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure any file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/audit/rules.d/ exists and is owned by user 0

Ensure at least one file named /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades exists and matches pattern ^\h*Unattended-Upgrade::Remove-Unused-Dependencies\h+["']true["'];\h*(#.*)?$

Ensure at least one file named /etc/audit/auditd.conf exists and matches pattern ^\h*action_mail_acct\h*=\h*\H+

systemdunitproperty_object.comment: Ensure systemd 'ctrl-alt-del.target' unit 'UnitFileState' property not equal 'active'
Ensure systemd 'kdump.service' unit 'UnitFileState' property not equal 'active'

textfilecontent54_object.comment: Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+\.conf$ in /etc/security/limits.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\h*\*\h+hard\h+maxlogins\h+(10|[1-9])\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+/.conf in /etc/rsyslog.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\h*(auth(\.\*)?,authpriv\.\*|authpriv\.\*,auth(\.\*)?)\h+\/var\/log\/secure\/?\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+\.conf in /etc/rsyslog.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\h*daemon\.notice\h+\/var\/log\/messages\/?\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure no file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+)?::AllowUnauthenticated\h+"?true"?;\h*(#.*)?$
Ensure no file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/sudoers.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h*)?\bNOPASSWD\b(.*)?$
Ensure no file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/sudoers.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*([^#\n\r]+\h+)?\!authenticate\b(\.*)?$
Ensure at least one file(s) named ^.+\.conf$ in /etc/sssd/conf.d/ exists and matches pattern (?i)^\h*offline_credentials_expiration\h*=\h*1\h*(#.*)?$
Ensurefile(s) named ^.+\.conf$ in /etc/sysctl.d/ exists and matches pattern ^\s*kernel\.randomize_va_space\s*=\s*([0-1]|[3-9]|[0-9][0-9]+)\b

file_object.comment: Ensure any file(s) named ^.*\.(conf|rules|prev)$ in /etc/audit/ exists and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx
Ensure any file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/audit/rules.d/ exists and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx
Ensure any file(s) named ^.*\.(conf|rules|prev)$ in /etc/audit/ exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure any file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/audit/rules.d/ exists and is owned by user 0

file_state.comment: Ensure at least one file named /usr/bin/journalctl exists and does not have permissions ----wxrwx
Ensure at least one file named /var/log/ exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure at least one file named /var/log/syslog exists and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx SUID SGID sticky

systemdunitproperty_state.comment: Ensure systemd 'ctrl-alt-del.target' unit 'UnitFileState' property not equal 'active'
Ensure systemd 'kdump.service' unit 'UnitFileState' property not equal 'active'

file_state.comment: Ensure any file(s) named ^.*\.(conf|rules|prev)$ in /etc/audit/ exists and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx
Ensure any file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/audit/rules.d/ exists and does not have permissions --x-wxrwx
Ensure any file(s) named ^.*\.(conf|rules|prev)$ in /etc/audit/ exists and is owned by user 0
Ensure any file(s) named ^.+$ in /etc/audit/rules.d/ exists and is owned by user 0
